docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
My personal notes documentation site.

It's here that I keep track of my findings on the settings and configurations of my main tools

docs.title: General
docs.text: Shortcut Description q Quit Ranger R Reload current directory ? Ranger Manpages / Shortcuts

docs.title: User setting
docs.text: Shortcut Description b set-color-scheme-from-image

docs.title: Main mode
docs.text: Shortcut Description g<x> Goto x T<x> Trash M<x> Select item preference z<x> Set settings preference o<x> Change sort order

docs.title: Movement
docs.text: Shortcut Description gg go to top of list G go t bottom of list H History Back L History Forward

docs.title: Search & Order
docs.text: Shortcut Description zf Filter .<x> Filter options f Find in realtime / search for files n next match N prev match

docs.title: File Operations
docs.text: Shortcut Description cw rename current file yy yank / copy dd cut pp paste +<x><x> add file permissions -<x><x> remove permissions

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: Shortcut Description : Execute Range Command ! Execute Shell Command r Open with

docs.title: Tabs
docs.text: Shortcut Description C-n Create new tab C-w Close current tab tab Next tab shift + tab Previous tab alt + [n] goto / create [n] tab

docs.title: File substituting
docs.text: Shortcut Description %f Substitute highlighted file %d Substitute current directory %s Substitute currently selected files %t Substitute currently tagged files

docs.title: Marker
docs.text: Shortcut Description m + <letter> Create Marker um + <letter> Delete Marker ' + <letter> Show Marker t tag a file with an * "<any> tag a file with your desired mark

docs.title: Bash
docs.text: set -x/+x # Enable/Disable debug bash script

docs.title: Sed
docs.text:
Replace in same file

sed -i.bak s/STRING_TO_REPLACE/STRING_TO_REPLACE_IT/g filename

docs.title: Cut column
docs.text: ls -alh | awk -F '-' '{ print $1,$7}'

docs.title: Recursively with filename
docs.text: grep -R "search text" --include "filename.ext"

docs.title: Perl
docs.text:
Replace between markup

    # http://superuser.com/questions/440013/how-to-replace-part-of-a-text-file-between-markers-with-another-text-file
newContent=$(cat src/filename)
sudo perl -0777 -i -pe "s/(### BEGIN MARKUP\\n).*(\\n### END MARKUP)/\$1$newContent\n\$2/s" dst/filename

docs.title: Pip
docs.text:
Install the git package version

# From command line
pip install git+https://github.com/username/project.git@branchname
# in the requirement file
-e git+https://github.com/username/projecyt.git@branchname#egg=project

docs.title: print
docs.text:
Print without return line 

print('.',end="",flush=True)

docs.title: If in one line
docs.text: value = 1 if 'true' in var  else 0

docs.title: Status
docs.text:
# Ignore untracked files
git config status.showuntrackedfiles no

docs.title: Cancel commit
docs.text: git reset HEAD~1

docs.title: Valid deleted file with rm
docs.text: git ls-files --deleted -z | xargs -0 git rm

docs.title: Delete file from Git repository
docs.text: git reset HEAD filename/directoryname

docs.title: Reset branch
docs.text:
git checkout mybranch
git reset --hard origin/mybranch

docs.title: Delete local branch
docs.text:
git branch -d the_local_branch
git branch -D the_local_branch # Force

docs.title: Delete remote branch
docs.text: git push origin :the_remote_branch

docs.title: Rename branch or move branch
docs.text: git branch -m oldbranch newbranch

docs.title: Display log commit
docs.text:
In you git .gitconfig

# In .gitconfig
[alias]
lg1 = log --graph --abbrev-commit --decorate --date=relative --format=format:'%C(bold blue)%h%C(reset) - %C(bold green)(%ar)%C(reset) %C(white)%s%C(reset) %C(dim white)- %an%C(reset)%C(bold yellow)%d%C(reset)' --all
lg2 = log --graph --abbrev-commit --decorate --format=format:'%C(bold blue)%h%C(reset) - %C(bold cyan)%aD%C(reset) %C(bold green)(%ar)%C(reset)%C(bold yellow)%d%C(reset)%n''          %C(white)%s%C(reset) %C(dim white)- %an%C(reset)' --all
lg = !"git lg1"

docs.title: Rebase by default when doing git pull
docs.text: git config --global pull.rebase true

docs.title: Reset Github fork
docs.text:
#http://scribu.net/blog/resetting-your-github-fork.html
git remote add upstream git://github.com/wp-cli/wp-cli.git
git fetch upstream
git branch backup
git checkout upstream/master -B master
git push --force

docs.title: Mkdocs & Github
docs.text:
Edit you mkdocs.yml 

pages:
- 'index.md'

Edit the index.md document with markdown syntax.

Now you can see your modification with mkdocs serve http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Prepare Github project (First time)
docs.text:
git clone github.com/user/repository.git
cd repository
mkdocs gh-deploy --clean

docs.title: Push the documentation
docs.text:
After updated your documentation, you can push to github

mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Keys creation and revoke old key
docs.text:
# Main key (Certify only)
gpg --quick-gen-key '<brunoadele@gmail.com>' rsa4096 cert 2y
export GPG_USERID=$(gpg -K | grep -oE "[a-fA-F0-9]{40}")
# Subkey
gpg --quick-addkey ${GPG_USERID} rsa4096 sign 2y
gpg --quick-addkey ${GPG_USERID} rsa4096 encr 2y
gpg --quick-addkey ${GPG_USERID} rsa4096 auth 2y

# Add adduid and photo [Optional]
gpg --quick-add-uid ${GPG_USERID} <new_email>
gpg --edit-key ${GPG_USERID}
gpg> trust
gpg> addphoto filename
gpg> save
gpg --check-trustdb

# Import old key [Optional]
gpg --import <oldkey>
gpg --edit-key <oldkey>
gpg> setpref clean quit

# Sign a new key with the oldkey if the key is not too old [Optional]
gpg --default-key <oldkeyid> --sign-key ${GPG_USERID}
# Sign oldkey with newkey [Optional]
gpg --default-key ${GPG_USERID} --sign-key <oldkey>

# Revoke oldkey [Optional]
gpg --gen-revoke <oldkey> > /tmp/revoke.asc
gpg --import /tmp/revoke.asc
gpg --send-keys <oldkey>

# Push public keys
gpg --send-key ${GPG_USERID}
# Backup (script in .local/bin)
# Before run bellow command, edit ~/.config/zsh/variables.zsh (GPG_USERID and GPG_BACKUP_DIR)
gpg-backup-keys

# Secure keys (delete primary key from computer)
# WARNING, delete only the primary key, it is also requested to delete the sub-keys
gpg --delete-secret-key ${GPG_USERID}
# Verify the computer not contain primary key
gpg -K # You should see 'sec#', indicates that the master key does not have a private key

docs.title: Re-import the private key & sub-keys
docs.text:
gpg --import ${GPG_BACKUP_DIR}/lastkeys/secret_key.gpg
gpg --import ${GPG_BACKUP_DIR}/lastkeys/secret_subkeys.gpg

docs.title: Update algorithme, expiration date, password
docs.text:
gpg --edit-key ${GPG_USERID}
key 0
setpref
expire
passwd
save

docs.title: Show gpg content
docs.text: gpg2 --card-status

docs.title: Edit GPG PIN
docs.text:
gpg2 --card-edit
passwd

docs.title: Edit gpg informations
docs.text:
gpg2 --card-edit
name
lang
login
sex

docs.title: Move gpg to yubikey
docs.text:
gpg2 -K
gpg2 --expert --edit-key <GPGID>
key 1
keytocard
key 2
keytocard
key 3
keytocard
save
quit

docs.title: Verify moved gpg key to yubikey
docs.text:
gpg2 -K
# You should see 'ssb>', indicates that the subkey key does not have a private key

docs.title: GPG agent configuration for SSH and GIT
docs.text: See files - ~/.gnupg/gpg-agent.conf - ~/.gnupg/sshcontrol - .gitconfig - ssh-add -L # show public SSH key

docs.title: Annex
docs.text:
# Show key information
gpg --edit-key <keyid>
gpg> showpref
# Another method
gpg --export <keyid> | gpg --list-packets

# show a key was signed by another key
gpg --list-sig <keyid>

# Import key
gpg --import <key file>

# Import remote key
gpg --recv-keys <keyid>

# Edit key
gpg --edit-key <keyid>

# Encrypt file
gpg --encrypt -o <encrypted file> [--recipient <keyid>] <file to encrypt>

# Decrypt
gpg --decrypt -o <encrypted file> <file to decrypt>

# Sign
gpg -o <sign file> --sign <file to sign>

# sign verification
gpg --verify <sign file>

docs.title: Troubles
docs.text:
#for f in $(ls ~/.ssh/*.pub); do
#  ssh-keygen -l -E md5 -f $f
#done
gpg-connect-agent "KEYINFO --ssh-list --ssh-fpr" /bye
gpg-connect-agent "DELETE_KEY <IDKEYS>" /bye

docs.title: Init
docs.text:
# export PASSWORD_STORE_DIR=${PRIVATE}/pass
cd $PRIVATE
git clone git@github.com:badele/pass.git
# pass init brunoadele@gmail.com
# pass git remote add origin git@github.com:badele/pass.git
# pass git push -u --all

docs.title: Chrome addon
docs.text: yay -S browserpass browserpass-chrome

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: • [_] cryptsetup

docs.title: Init LUKS USB disk
docs.text:
# Detect usb disk
blkid && lsblk
export LUKSDISK=/dev/sdc1
export DISKNAME=black-disk

# Reset disk
wipefs -a $LUKSDISK

# Init LUKS parition
cryptsetup luksFormat ${LUKSDISK}
cryptsetup config ${LUKSDISK} --label luks-${DISKNAME}

# Open previous created LUKS disk
cryptsetup luksOpen /dev/disk/by-label/luks-${DISKNAME} luks-${DISKNAME}

# Create parition
mkfs.ext4 /dev/mapper/luks-${DISKNAME} -L usb-${DISKNAME}

# Mount partition
mkdir -p /mnt/usb-${DISKNAME}
mount /dev/mapper/luks-${DISKNAME} /mnt/usb-${DISKNAME}

docs.title: Mount/umount LUKS disk
docs.text:
# Mount encrypted luks disk
cryptsetup luksOpen /dev/disk/by-label/luks-${DISKNAME} luks-${DISKNAME}
mount /dev/mapper/luks-${DISKNAME} /mnt/usb-${DISKNAME}

# Umount
cryptsetup luksClose luks-${DISKNAME}

docs.title: Misc
docs.text:
# Show opened luks disk
dmsetup ls

# Show luks informations
cryptsetup luksDump ${LUKSDISK}

docs.title: User
docs.text:
Force user change password next logon

sudo chage -d 0 username

docs.title: Process
docs.text:
Change process limitation without restart

prlimit --pid 23403 --nofile=2048:2048`

docs.title: Route
docs.text:
Clear route cache 

ip route flush cache

List chache ofr destination

ip route list cache match 10.19.2.70

10.19.2.70 from 10.75.16.146 dev eth0 cache 10.19.2.70 dev eth0  src 10.75.16.146 cache <redirected>

Show route use for destination

ip route get 8.8.8.8

8.8.8.8 via 10.75.16.2 dev eth0  src 10.75.16.146 cache

docs.title: Resize partition and filesystem
docs.text:
fdisk /dev/xxx
p
d
n
w

#reboot 
resize2fs /dev/xxx

docs.title: Repair vfat filesystem
docs.text: dosfsck -w -r -l -a -v -t /dev/sdb1

docs.title: TMUX
docs.text:
Sharing the tmux session

On terminal you would like sharing 

tmux new-session -s shared
On another computer 
tmux attach-session -t shared

docs.title: SSH
docs.text:
Show ssh fingerprint

ssh-keygen -l -E md5 -f ~/.ssh/id_dsa.pub

docs.title: Create pptp account
docs.text: pptpsetup --create profilename --server pptp_server_hostname --username username --password PASSWORD --encrypt

docs.title: Connect or Disconnect to pptp server
docs.text:
pon profilename
poff profilename

docs.title: Route
docs.text:
For automatically add route when ppp interface is up, you can add the script into this folder /etc/ppp/ip-up.d/route-to-ppp.sh

#!/bin/bash
IFACE="ppp0"
NET=$(ifconfig $IFACE | egrep -o "inet [0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+" | cut -d" " -f2 | cut -d"." -f1-3).0
route add -net ${NET} dev ${IFACE}

docs.title: PostgreSQL
docs.text:
Show sessions

SELECT datname as database,
usename as username,
application_name as application,
client_addr as client_address
FROM pg_stat_activity

docs.title: Rsync
docs.text:
No change owner file permision on remote

rsync -avr --no-o xxxx

docs.title: tcpdump
docs.text:
Show detailed packet information

tcpdump -i etho  -vv -s 1600
tcpdump -vni eth0 -XX -s 0

Howto detect the close session cycle

Terminal-1 

tcpdump -ni eth0 "tcp[tcpflags] & (tcp-fin) != 0" -w /tmp/tcpdump

Terminal-2 

netstat -an | grep CLOSE | sort > /tmp/diff1
sleep 60
netstat -an | grep CLOSE | sort > /tmp/diff2
diff /tmp/diff1 /tmp/diff2
tcpdump  "tcp[tcpflags] & (tcp-fin) != 0" -r /tmp/tcpdump

docs.title: Swap
docs.text:
For free swap

swapoff -a
swapon -a

docs.title: sysdig
docs.text:
sysdig -cl # list-chisels
sysdig -w dumpfile.scap # Write dump
sysdig -r dumpfile.scap # Read dump
csysdig -r dumpfile.scap # Ncurse GUI & Read dump

docs.title: sysctl
docs.text:
If you receive this message sysctl: permission denied on key 'xxx.xxx.xxx' in your openvz container. You cannot change the sysctl options in the openvz container, for that, you can set this options in the host hypervisor. 

# In the hypervisor
nano /etc/sysctl.conf
#xxx.xxx.xxx=somevalue
#
sysctl -p

docs.title: salt-master command
docs.text:
# Set state on all computers
salt '*' state.highstate

# Set specific state 
salt '*' state.apply your_statename,your_statename1

# Show the top state result
salt '*' state.show_top

# Show minion version
salt '*' test.version

# Mass minion update
salt '*' cmd.run "curl -L https://bootstrap.saltstack.com | sh -s -- -PA masterip stable 2015.8"
# Update master
curl -L https://bootstrap.saltstack.com | sh -s -- -P -M stable 2015.8
curl -L https://bootstrap.saltstack.com | sh -s -- -P -M git v2015.8.8

# Show mass minion state (is up)
salt-run manage.status

# Show minion job (from master)
salt-run jobs.active

# Kill job
salt '*' saltutil.kill_job JOBID

docs.title: Debug
docs.text:
# Debug salt-call command
salt-call state.highstate -lall
# Debug minion
salt-minion -l debug

docs.title: Unbound
docs.text:
• Diagnose
  • Check the unbound configuration with unbound-checkconf

docs.title: Collectd
docs.text:
• Diagnose
  • Check collectd config collectd -t
  • Check collecd plugins collectd -T
  • Check collecd in foreground mode collectd -f

docs.title: Oh My Zsh
docs.text:
• Disable git status in prompt
  • Some project have many files, and Oh My Zsh is slow for respond, For some project, you can disable git prompt feature. Go to your git project and type this command
  • git config --add oh-my-zsh.hide-status 1

docs.title: urxvt
docs.text:
• Know the font and current character
  • CRTL + SHIFT & mouse click

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• [_] btrfs partition
  • [_] snapper
  • [_] snap-pac (for snapshot after pacman installation)

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
# Create root config
snapper create-config -c root /
snapper create-config -c home /home

# List configs
snapper list-configs

docs.title: Snapshots
docs.text:
# Create snapshot
snapper -c root create [--desc comment]

# List snapshot
snapper list

# Compare snapshot
snapper -c root status id..0

# Diff snapshot file
snapper -c root diff id..0 filename

# Undo snapshot file
sudo snapper -c root -v undochange id..0 FILENAME1 FILENAME2

# rollback snapshot file
sudo snapper -c root -v rollback id

# Delete snapshot
snapper -c root delete id
